The Restoration of James White [STATEMENT 
       MADE APRIL 13, 1902, AT A COUNCIL MEETING 
        AT ELMSHAVEN, ST. HELENA, CALIFORNIA.] 


     Many years ago [1865], while my husband was bearing heavy responsibilities in Battle Creek, the strain began to tell on him. His health failed rapidly. Finally he broke down in mind and body, and was unable to do anything. My friends said to me, "Mrs. White, your husband cannot live." I determined to remove him to a place more favorable for his recovery. His mother said, "Ellen, you must remain and take care of your family."
